name: nice
shortDescription: run a program with modified scheduling priority
longDescription: Run  COMMAND  with an adjusted niceness, which affects process scheduling.  With no COMMAND, print the current niceness.  Niceness values range from -20 (most favorable to the  process)  to  19  (least  favorable  to  the process).

options.name: adjustment
options.description: Add ADJUSTMENT instead of 10 to the command’s niceness.  If ADJUSTMENT is negative and you lack appropriate privileges, ‘nice’ issues a warning but otherwise acts as if you specified a zero adjustment.
